questions.question: What modern architectural marvel in Germany is known for its unique mirrored facade and serves as the headquarters for an automotive giant?
questions.context: Opened in 2007, its futuristic architecture attracts car enthusiasts and tourists alike.

questions.question: What is the ancient ruin located on a hill in the heart of Athens, Greece, known as the pinnacle of ancient Greek architecture?
questions.context: This iconic site, built in the 5th century BC, includes the Parthenon and symbolizes the birthplace of democracy.

questions.question: Where in northeastern France did one of the most significant battles of World War I take place, known for the magnitude of its casualties in 1916?
questions.context: The Battle of Verdun was one of the longest battles in history, lasting over 300 days and heavily influencing the course of the war.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in South America is famous for its mysterious geoglyphs and was created by the Nazca culture?
questions.context: Spanning an area of about 50 square kilometers, these pre-Columbian designs are best viewed from the air.

questions.question: In which European city does the modern museum, known for housing the works of Salvador Dalí and resembling a giant egg, reside?
questions.context: Opened in 1974 in Dalí’s hometown, this museum houses the largest single collection of his works.
